alert.note: Alert for Eastern Orleans; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:07PM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern St. Bernard, southeastern St. Charles, Orleans, northwestern Jefferson and northwestern Plaquemines Parishes through 245 PM CST... At 207 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of New Orleans to near Avondale. Movement was northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... New Orleans, Chalmette, Marrero, Harvey, Avondale, East New Orleans, Timberlane, Belle Chasse, Metairie, Jefferson, Gretna, Harahan, Westwego, Woodmere, Violet, Terrytown, Meraux, Bridge City, Poydras and Estelle. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 229 and 255. Interstate 510 between mile markers 1 and 3. Interstate 610 between mile markers 1 and 4. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Orleans; St. Charles; Upper Jefferson; Upper Plaquemines; Upper St. Bernard; Western Orleans
